column4: i have no sound when playign .mp3 files in amarok anyone know why
yes i get sound when on youtube
ok i found th eproblem but now i have issues with my headset
i can hear myself in my headset
yes i got volume now but my microphone keeps giving me feedback
what can i do to fix my microphone i muted line in and microphone
it seems tied to PCM but not sure what that is
do you see a small speaker icon around the top-right corner of your screen?
right-click on it and select "Open Volume Control" from the context menu
if you want to use the mic, unmute it and increase its volume to the desired level.
oh. then unmute the microphone but decrease the volume to an acceptable level. does that work?
which slider are you lowering?
yes your problem makes sense (i think). when you speak into the microphone, you are hearing yourself through the head phones. but you do not want to hear yourself. is that right?
which slider are you moving? you should be moving the microphone slider not the pcm or master sliders
is the mic plugged into the microphone slot or the line-in slot?
try sliding the line-in slider
what happens if the microphone is muted. you can still hear yourself?
hmm. i'm not sure then. are you using a headphone-microphone combination?

maybe it's the device itself. i suppose it's possible that the speakers in the headphones are picking up the same signal being sent to the computer through the microphone. do you have access to another computer (running a different operating system, preferably) to test the device on?
Open Volume Control again.
then go to File > Change Device. How many devices are there? Try changing the selected device and muting/unmuting the microphone slider there.
which one was selected all this time?
